Package BusinessLogic

Class ClientBLL

java.lang.Object
BusinessLogic.ClientBLL
public class ClientBLL
extends java.lang.Object
Based on the request of the controller, it manages the raw input given, validates it, transforms it into essential client data and then applies one of the CRUD operations

  • Method Details

    • findClient

      public Client findClient​(java.lang.String ID) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the ID given by the user If found to be correct, it searches for the corresponding client
      Parameters:
      ID - The id given by the user
      Returns:
      A client object with the given ID
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the ID was invalid

    • getAllClients

      public java.lang.String[][] getAllClients()
      Returns all the clients for JTable insertion format
      Returns:
      A String matrix with the data corresponding to the clients

    • createClient

      public void createClient​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String phone) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Insert into the database a client with the given fields. All of the data is checked before continuing with the insertion
      Parameters:
      firstName - The first name of the new Client
      lastName - The last name of the new Client
      email - The email address
      phone - The phone number
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the fields has an invalid format

    • deleteClient

      public void deleteClient() throws java.lang.Exception
      Deletes a client with the ID saved in the clientID attribute of the class
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If the client has links with any previous orders

    • updateClient

      public void updateClient​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String phone)
      Updates an existing client. The client was previously searched so its identification code is saved in the clientID attribute of the class. The new fields may have the same value as the previous ones
      Parameters:
      firstName - The new first name
      lastName - The new last name
      email - The new email address
      phone - The new phone number

    • setClientID

      public void setClientID​(java.lang.String ID)
      Sets the value of the attribute clientID
      Parameters:
      ID - String containing the ID
